dcterms:creator: A. Chaouche
M. Boulif
dcterms:description: The graph partitioning problem (GPP) is a combinatorial optimization problem that seeks to partition the vertices of a graph into disjoint subsets to optimize the cost of the overall cut weight.
dcterms:title: Graph Partitioning Problem (GPP)

dcterms:creator: M. Boulif
K. Atif
dcterms:description: The edge-based genetic algorithm (EE) is a representation scheme that uses edges instead of vertices to define a graph partition, showing promising features for solving the graph partitioning problem.
dcterms:title: Edge-based Genetic Algorithm (EE)

dcterms:creator: M. Boulif
dcterms:description: This dataset includes various genetic algorithm encoding representations specifically designed for graph partitioning problems.
dcterms:title: Genetic Algorithm (GA) Parameters
